result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Arson of Building w/o Owner's Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Travion K Owens

records.addlTxt: Repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing December 15, 2022. (BC)

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
11:16 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. . Defendant Travion K Owens in court. 

The Court calls the matter for Status of Counsel
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. 
Court swears defendant.
The Court goes over the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork with the Defendant on the record.
Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $100.00 per month commencing December 15, 2022. 
THE COURT ORDERS THE DEFENDANT TO GO TO THE BUSINESS CENTER (Rm. 112) RIGHT AFTER COURT TO SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A (or their residence, employment, school or anywhere they frequent)/Witness B/Witness C/Witness D/Witness E listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. Defendant to comply with GPS monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services. Defendant is to have no contact with the City of New Berlin with the exception of emergency purposes only and if he is traveling on the interstate. Defendant to report to WCS the first business day after their release from custody. Defendant is not to use/possess any burglarious tools.

1:36 PM Defendant Travion K Owens in court, in custody. Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Travion K Owens. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Attorney Menden appears as friend of the court. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel. Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 10:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key, Signed by Judge J. Arthur Melvin on October 27, 2022.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor
